ARTICLE.TITLE: Prep schools renew appeal with promise of kindness
ARTICLE.TEXT:
Many prep schools are under financial pressure, with 3,000 fewer pupils nationally this year

Preparatory schools are marketing their smaller classes, leafy grounds and safe spaces to try to stem the tide of parents choosing state education.

Many are under financial pressure, with 3,000 fewer pupils nationally this year and some face a “slow and gentle good night” because of improvements in state primaries, the editor of The Good Schools Guide has warned.

In response, a number of schools are making a virtue of an ethos of kindness and mental health support. The nurturing focus is a shift from the academic thrust of preps established to prepare children for entrance to independent schools.

Beacon School, a boys’ prep in Buckinghamshire, has adopted a slow approach to make “time more meaningful” and replaced homework diaries with journals for personal reflection.
